body: I don't believe tiny-yolo is supported at the moment. How did you train one?
Cope the yolov3-tiny.cfg to cfg dir，change train.py point to yolov3-tiny.cfg ， change few function in yololayer class，and the code is runnable.
@Ryanshuai just to clarify, you wrote the code to support tiny-yolov3 yourself or are you asking the author of this repository to do this for you?

I think he’s saying he added code to create yolove-tiny initialized with random weights. 

@ryanshuai, it would be useful before you try to train on this network to verify that inference works well using the official yolov3-tiny.weights.
@glenn-jocher I will try what you said， thanks！

@Ryanshuai @nirbenz all done guys! I modified `models.py` to be yolov3-tiny.cfg friendly in the latest commit. I think this should probably extend to yolov3-spp.cfg functionality also. yolov3-tiny returns identical inference results to darknet now, and @Ryanshuai you should be able to train it properly now.

`./darknet detect cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg yolov3-tiny.weights data/dog.jpg`
![50227882-c48a5300-0374-11e9-95b3-6cf8254aee64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/50374076-b3497c80-05e8-11e9-8d41-acd42d3fbfc6.jpg)
`detect.py --cfg cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg --weights weights/yolov3-tiny.pt`
![dog](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/50374086-d411d200-05e8-11e9-9987-ee0c81af4bbc.jpg)

issue.title: cannot use yolov3-tiny ?
issue.body:
when I use yolov3-tiny: python3 detect.py --image_folder data/samples --config_path config/yolov3-tiny.cfg --weights_path weights/yolov3-tiny.weights
it show this error: RuntimeError: Given groups=1, weight of size [256, 256, 3, 3], expected input[1, 384, 26, 26] to have 256 channels, but got 384 channels instead
Could you tell me the reason?

body: yolov3-tiny detect demo is ok, is anybody test the train process for yolov3-tiny?
@GreenTeaHua I'm going to close this issue for now unless you have any other questions.

issue.title: different width/height offset learning compared with darknet?

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
I noticed the log transformation of w/h offset in this repo was different from darknet as my understanding.
[utils/build_targets @Line 227](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/utils/utils.py)
`TC[b, :nTb], gx, gy, gw, gh = t[:, 0].long(), t[:, 1] * nG, t[:, 2] * nG, t[:, 3] * nG, t[:, 4] * nG`
here, `xy` and `wh` are all relative to grid e.g.(input=416, grid=13/26/52), so as to `anchor * exp(t_w)`
but in darknet, `xy` are relative to grid, `wh` are relative to input as my understanding, `anchor * exp(t_w)` doesn't need to scale.
[yolo_layer.c @Line 88](https://github.com/pjreddie/darknet/blob/master/src/yolo_layer.c)
`b.w = exp(x[index + 2*stride]) * biases[2*n]   / w;`

so if predicting with the weight file provided by the author, I think this will cause some mistakes.

body:
> yolov3-tiny detect demo is ok, is anybody test the train process for yolov3-tiny?

I have actually started using this model for detection of my IR images. along with the video frames extracted and annotated
1. when i used only images and its augmentations to train the model . detection was  okish. like IOU was around 59 % and MAP was 65 %.

2. when i used image plus  frames extracted and their augmentations , model failed to detect objects in frames. .
SO i can say for image data , it is ok to start with playing around.
